docs.title: Welcome to the MinecraftGPT API
docs.text:
The MinecraftGPT API is the central AI backend for all MinecraftGPT projects. It provides a unified, secure, and scalable interface for AI-powered gameplay features.

This documentation will guide you through setting up, configuring, and using the API.

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: The MinecraftGPT API provides a single endpoint for chat interactions.

docs.title: POST /chat
docs.text: This endpoint is used to send a message from a player to the AI and receive a reply.

docs.title: Request Body
Response Body
docs.text:
The endpoint returns a JSON object with a single field:

Field Type Description reply string The AI's response to the message.

Example JSON Response:

{
  "reply": "To bake a cake in Minecraft, you'll need 3 buckets of milk, 2 sugar, 1 egg, and 3 wheat. Enjoy!"
}

docs.title: Error Responses
docs.text:
If an error occurs, the reply field will contain an error message.

Example Error:

{
  "reply": "Error: OPENROUTER_API_KEY not configured in config.yml."
}

docs.title: Features
docs.text: The MinecraftGPT API is designed to be flexible and robust. Here are some of the key features:

docs.title: Player Memory
docs.text:
The API remembers the context of recent conversations for each player individually. This allows players to ask follow-up questions and have more natural interactions.

  • Configuration: The number of conversation turns to remember is set by max_history_size in config.yml.

docs.title: Model Flexibility
docs.text:
You can define a default AI model for all requests and optionally allow clients (like a Minecraft plugin) to override the model on a per-request basis.

  • Configuration:
    • default_name: The model to use if none is specified in the request.
    • allow_client_override: Set to true to allow clients to send a model field in their requests.

docs.title: Rate Limiting
docs.text:
To prevent spam and abuse, the API includes a built-in rate limiter. It limits how many requests can be made from a single IP address in a given time period.

  • Configuration: The rate_limit setting in config.yml controls this feature (e.g., "15/minute").

docs.title: Centralized Configuration
docs.text: All major settings are managed in the config.yml file, making it easy to update the API's behavior without changing any code. This includes: - API keys - Model settings (name, temperature) - System prompts - Memory and security settings

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This guide will walk you through setting up the MinecraftGPT API for the first time.

docs.title: 2. Install Dependencies
docs.text:
Make sure you have Python 3.8+ installed. Then, install the required packages:

pip install -r requirements.txt

docs.title: 3. Configure the API
docs.text:
The API is configured using the config.yml file.

  1. Create the config file: Rename config.yml.example to config.yml.

  2. Set your API Key: Open config.yml and replace "your_openrouter_api_key" with your actual API key from OpenRouter.ai.

    yaml api: openrouter_api_key: "your_openrouter_api_key"

  3. Customize (Optional): Review the other settings in config.yml to customize the default model, system prompt, rate limits, and more.

docs.title: 4. Run the Server
docs.text:
uvicorn main:app --reload

The API will now be running at http://127.0.0.1:8000.
